intro: Phacelia longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phacelia longipes is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
